def_en: If you overload something such as a vehicle, you put more things or people into it than it was designed to carry.

def_cn: 使负担过重；给予…过多的工作（或问题、信息等）
def_en: To overload someone with work, problems, or information means to give them more work, problems, or information than they can cope with.

def_cn: 使（电力系统）过载；使超过负荷
def_en: If you overload an electrical system, you cause too much electricity to flow through it, and so damage it.
